chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian J. Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian J. Smith was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Brian J. Smith was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond applie  -  Balance to be collected
$500 to the Kenosha County D.A.R.E. Program

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $5000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $12907.40  plus surcharges.   Perform  250  hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  Pay $500 to the Kenosha County D.A.R.E. Program and maintain a stable residence.  DL is revoked for 5 years.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Defendant, Brian J. Smith, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and statement given by victim's family in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 & 3 - DE is sentenced to 7 years in the WSP forthwith; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions.  Both counts are Consecutive to each other.  Credit for 18 days.  DE is taken into custody.  Parties stipulate to Restitution in the amount of $12,907.40.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Cash Bond on deposit to be applied to restitution and costs.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
